intro: Epacris dubia var. subreflexa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and clusters of tubular, pinkish-white flowers. The leaves are narrow and often covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is typically found in heathlands and open forests. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
